events.title: Assassination of Thomas Becket
events.description: Thomas Becket, Archbishop of Canterbury, was murdered inside Canterbury Cathedral by knights loyal to King Henry II of England.
events.significance: This event caused a major conflict between the church and the monarchy, leading to Becket's martyrdom and sainthood.

events.title: Texas Admitted to the United States
events.description: Texas was admitted as the 28th state of the United States, following its independence from Mexico.
events.significance: This admission intensified disputes that contributed to the Mexican-American War and shaped U.S. territorial expansion.

events.title: Death of Sitting Bull
events.description: Native American leader Sitting Bull was killed by Indian police during an attempt to arrest him, fearing he would join the Ghost Dance movement.
events.significance: His death marked a turning point in the U.S. government's efforts to suppress Native American resistance.

events.title: First Successful Flight of the Douglas DC-4
events.description: The prototype of the Douglas DC-4, a four-engine propeller-driven airliner, completed its first flight.
events.significance: The DC-4 became a highly successful aircraft in both commercial aviation and military transport during and after World War II.

events.title: Apollo 17 Returns to Earth
events.description: The last manned mission of NASA's Apollo program, Apollo 17, splashed down safely in the Pacific Ocean.
events.significance: Apollo 17 marked the final mission of the Apollo lunar program, ending an era of human exploration of the Moon.
